{{BLP sources|date = December 2017}} {{Infobox football biography |name = Lukas Nmecha |image = |fullname = Lukas Nmecha{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/612828 |title=Updated squads for 2017/18 Premier League confirmed |publisher=Premier League |date=2 February 2018 |accessdate=12 February 2018}} | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1998|12|12|df=yes}}{{cite web|url=https://www.11v11.com/players/lukas-nmecha-256131/|title=Profile|accessdate=17 January 2019|publisher=11v11}} | birth_place = [[Hamburg]], Germany | height = {{height|ft=6|in=0}} | currentclub = [[Preston North End F.C.|Preston North End]]
(on loan from [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]]) | clubnumber = 45 | position = [[Forward (association football)|Forward]] / [[Midfielder#Winger|Winger]] | youthyears1 = 2007–2017 | youthclubs1 = [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] | years1 = 2017– | clubs1 = [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] | caps1 = 2 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2018– | clubs2 = → [[Preston North End F.C.|Preston North End]] (loan) | caps2 = 22 | goals2 = 2 | nationalyears1 = 2013 | nationalteam1 = [[England national under-16 football team|England U16]] | nationalcaps1 = 2 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2014–2015 | nationalteam2 = [[England national under-17 football team|England U17]] | nationalcaps2 = 10 | nationalgoals2 = 2 | nationalyears3 = 2016 | nationalteam3 = [[England national under-18 football team|England U18]] | nationalcaps3 = 4 | nationalgoals3 = 2 | nationalyears4 = 2016–2017 | nationalteam4 = [[England national under-19 football team|England U19]] | nationalcaps4 = 11 | nationalgoals4 = 3 | nationalyears5 = 2018– | nationalteam5 = [[England national under-20 football team|England U20]] | nationalcaps5 = 1 | nationalgoals5 = 1 | nationalyears6 = 2018– | nationalteam6 = [[England national under-21 football team|England U21]] | nationalcaps6 = 3 | nationalgoals6 = 0 | pcupdate = 21:56, 17 January 2019 (UTC) | ntupdate = 21:56, 17 January 2019 (UTC) }} '''Lukas Nmecha''' (born 12 December 1998) is an professional footballer who plays for [[Preston North End F.C.|Preston North End]] on loan from [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]]. Lukas was born in [[Hamburg]], Germany but relocated to England as a child with his family. He is a current [[England national under-21 football team|England U21]]'s international. ==Club career== He was scouted by Manchester City, where he played for their youth ranks for over a decade, before making his debut on 19 December 2017 in the [[2017–18 EFL Cup|EFL Cup]].{{cite web|url=https://www.mancity.com/news/first-team/match-report/2017/december/leicester-city-v-manchester-city-carabao-cup-match-report|title=Leicester v City: Match report|website=MCFC}} On his debut he scored the third penalty for Manchester City in their penalty shootout win over [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]].{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/live/2017/dec/19/leicester-city-v-manchester-city-carabao-cup-quarter-final-live|title=Leicester City 1-1 Manchester City (3-4 on pens): Carabao Cup quarter-final – as it happened|author=Paul Doyle}} He made his Premier League debut on 29 April 2018, as a late substitute for [[Gabriel Jesus]] against [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] at the [[London Stadium]].{{cite web|title=Match Report.|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/apr/29/west-ham-united-manchester-city-premier-league-match-report}} He was involved in several games during Manchester City's first team squad for the 2018-19 pre season tour in the U.S. to compete in the [[2018 International Champions Cup]].{{cite news|url=https://www.mancity.com/news/first%20team/first%20team%20news/2018/july/man%20city%20us%20preseason%20tour%20travelling%20squad|title=US TOUR SQUAD CONFIRMED|publisher=Manchester City Official|date=17 July 2018|accessdate=30 July 2018}} He scored his first goal at first team level on 29 July 2018 in the pre season friendly against [[Bayern Munich]] in a 3-2 win.{{cite news|url=https://www.mancity.com/news/first-team/first-team-news/2018/july/man-city-striker-lukas-nmecha-relieved-to-get-up-and-running|title=NMECHA RELIEVED TO GET OFF THE MARK|publisher=Manchester City Official|date=28 July 2018|accessdate=3 August 2018}}{{cite news|url=https://fcbayern.com/en/matches/profis/testspiele/2018-2019/fc-bayern-muenchen-manchester-city-28-07-2018-lineup|title=Bayern Munich 2 Man City 3|publisher=Bayern Munich Official|date=28 July 2018|accessdate=30 July 2018}} Nmecha was loaned to [[Preston North End F.C.|Preston North End]] for the 2018–19 season.{{cite web |title=Lukas Nmecha joins Preston on loan|url=https://www.mancity.com/news/first-team/first-team-news/2018/august/man-city-preston-lukas-nmecha-transfer-news-season-loan |publisher=Manchester City FC|accessdate=9 August 2018}} ==International career== Born in [[Hamburg]] to German and Nigerian parents, but raised in England, Nmecha is eligible to play for [[Nigeria national football team|Nigeria]], [[Germany national football team|Germany]] and [[England national football team|England]]. Since 2016, he has featured for England's [[England national under-18 football team|under-18]] and [[England national under-19 football team|under-19]] teams. At the [[2017 UEFA European Under-19 Championship]], he scored the winning goals in both the semi-final and final to give England their 10th title. On 18 May 2018, Nmecha received a call up to [[England national under-21 football team|England U21]]s by Manager [[Adrian Boothroyd]], for the [[Toulon Tournament]] with England's group containing fixtures against [[Qatar national under-20 football team|Qatar U21]]s, China U21s and [[Mexico national under-20 football team|Mexico U21]]s.{{citenews|publisher=FA.COM|date=18 May 2018|accessdate=18 May 2018|title=ENGLAND U21S HEAD TO MAURICE REVELLO TOURNAMENT IN TOULON WITH A 20-MAN SQUAD |url=http://www.thefa.com/news/2018/may/18/england-u21s-squad-named-for-toulon-180518}} On 9 June 2018, Nmecha came on as a substitute in the [[2018 Toulon Tournament]] final against [[Mexico national under-20 football team|Mexico U21]]s with England winning the tournament after beating Mexico 2–1 in the final.{{citenews|publisher=BBC Sport|date=9 June 2018|accessdate=9 June 2018|title=England win third straight Toulon Tournament title after victory over Mexico|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/live/football/44396993}} ==Style of play== Nmecha's main positition is as a [[Forward (association football)|Centre Forward]], but he is also able to play as a [[Midfielder#Winger|Winger]] on either side. He is known for being comfortable with both feet and for his first touch and finishing ability.{{citenews|publisher=Manchester City|date=18 May 2018|accessdate=3 August 2018|title=Lukas Nmecha: Player Profile|url=https://www.mancity.com/teams/first%20team/strikers/lukas%20nmecha#profile-bio}} Nmecha described that he also likes to use his pace to run at defenders.{{citenews|publisher=Manchester City|date=30 July 2018|accessdate=3 August 2018|title=Vincent Kompany is helping Man City prospect Lukas Nmecha take his game to the next level |url=https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/man-city-lukas-nmecha-kompany-14966606}} ==Career statistics== {{updated|match played 6 January 2019}} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |+Appearances and goals by club, season and competition |- !rowspan="2"|Club !rowspan="2"|Season !colspan="3"|League !colspan="2"|[[FA Cup]] !colspan="2"|[[EFL Cup|League Cup]] !colspan="2"|Other !colspan="2"|Total |- !Division!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals |- |[[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] |[[2017–18 Manchester City F.C. season|2017–18]]{{cite web|title=Lukas Nmecha|url=http://www.soccerbase.com/players/player.sd?player_id=107009|website=Soccerbase}} |[[Premier League]] |2||0||0||0||1||0||0||0||3||0 |- |[[Manchester City F.C. EDS and Academy|Manchester City U23]] |[[2017–18 EFL Trophy|2017–18]] |colspan=1|—||colspan=2|—||colspan=2|—||colspan=2|—||2{{efn|name=EFLT|Appearances in [[EFL Trophy]]}}||1||2||1 |- |[[Preston North End F.C.|Preston North End]] (loan) |[[2018–19 Preston North End F.C. season|2018–19]] |[[EFL Championship|Championship]] |22||2||1||0||2||0||colspan="2"|—||25||2 |- !colspan="3"|Career total !24!!2!!1!!0!!3!!0!!2!!1!!30!!3 |} {{notelist}} ==Honours== '''[[England national under-21 football team|England U21]]''' *'''[[2018 Toulon Tournament]] Champions''' '''England U19''' *[[2017 UEFA European Under-19 Championship|UEFA European Under-19 Championship]]: [[2017 UEFA European Under-19 Championship|2017]]{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/jul/15/football-under-19-uefa-england-portugal-final|title=England win European Under-19 Championship as youth shines again|work=The Guardian|date=15 July 2017}} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.thefa.com/england/all-teams/players?p=355907 England profile] at [[The Football Association]] {{Preston North End F.C. squad}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Nmecha, Lukas}} [[Category:1998 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Footballers from Hamburg]] [[Category:English footballers]] [[Category:England youth international footballers]] [[Category:German footballers]] [[Category:German people of Nigerian descent]] [[Category:English people of Nigerian descent]] [[Category:English people of German descent]] [[Category:Manchester City F.C. players]] [[Category:Preston North End F.C. players]] [[Category:Association football forwards]] [[Category:German emigrants to England]] [[Category:Premier League players]]
